newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee ends lower on demand for dolllars.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee ends lower on demand for dolllars.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee closed lower against the dollar on Tuesday due to late commercial demand for the greenback, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 57.77 to the dollar, after opening at 57.68. It closed at 57.63 to the dollar on Monday.
"Late import covering got on top of early speculation to take the dollar up," said a Standard Chartered dealer.
The Central Bank pushed the dollar up by five local cents on its overseas strength. Buying and selling prices were fixed at 57.0082 and 58.1598.
Overnight call money rates closed at 12.5 percent after opening at 13 percent, they said.
"Call rates should remain at around current levels because the market is well offered," said a Sampath Bank dealer.
